001package edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.viewmodel;
002
003import android.content.Context;
004import android.util.Log;
005import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
006import androidx.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleObserver;
007import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
008import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
009import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
010import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
011import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
012import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.R;
014import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.service.AlertRepository;
015import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.service.PreferencesRepository;
016import io.reactivex.rxjava3.disposables.CompositeDisposable;
017import javax.inject.Inject;
018
019/**
020 * This provides an interface for the UI  to see countdown events, both individual ticks and the
021 * completion event itself.  ALso this interfaces between the UI and the password checker
022 */
023@HiltViewModel
024public class AlertViewModel extends ViewModel implements DefaultLifecycleObserver {
025
026  private static final String TAG = AlertViewModel.class.getSimpleName();
027  private final AlertRepository alertRepository;
028  private final PreferencesRepository preferencesRepository;
029  private final MutableLiveData<Long> timerStep;
030  private final MutableLiveData<Long> timeRemaining;
031  private final MutableLiveData<Boolean> timeExpired;
032  private final MutableLiveData<Boolean> passwordCorrect;
033  private final String countdownKey;
034  private final int countdownDefault;
035  private final MutableLiveData<Throwable> throwable;
036  private final CompositeDisposable pending;
037
038  /**
039   * This initializes the interface between the UI and the repositories.  This also captures the
040   * seekbar preference for countdown delay time
041   * @param context
042   * @param repository
043   * @param preferencesRepository
044   */
045  @Inject
046  public AlertViewModel(@ApplicationContext Context context, AlertRepository repository,
047      PreferencesRepository preferencesRepository) {
048    this.alertRepository = repository;
049    this.preferencesRepository = preferencesRepository;
050    timerStep = new MutableLiveData<>();
051    timeRemaining = new MutableLiveData<>();
052    timeExpired = new MutableLiveData<>();
053    passwordCorrect = new MutableLiveData<>();
054    countdownKey = context.getString(R.string.countdown_key);
055    countdownDefault = context.getResources().getInteger(R.integer.countdown_default);
056    throwable = new MutableLiveData<>();
057    pending = new CompositeDisposable();
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * This starts the countdown timer and sets its duration in seconds
062   */
063  public void startTimer(){
064    int countdown = preferencesRepository.get(countdownKey, countdownDefault);
065    throwable.setValue(null);
066    timeExpired.setValue(false);
067    alertRepository.getCountdownTimer(countdown)
068        .subscribe(
069            timeRemaining::postValue,
070            this::postThrowable,
071            ()-> timeExpired.postValue(true),
072            pending
073        );
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * This check the disarm password
078   * @param inputPassword
079   * @return
080   */
081  public boolean checkPassword(String inputPassword){
082    return alertRepository.checkPassword(inputPassword);
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * This returns the amount of time remaining in the countdown.  This is returned to the UI for display
087   * @return
088   */
089  public LiveData<Long> getTimeRemaining() {
090    return timeRemaining;
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * This returns the timer complete event in the form of a boolean
095   * @return
096   */
097  public LiveData<Boolean> getTimeExpired() {
098    return timeExpired;
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * This returns the throwable for the subscribe
103   * @return
104   */
105  public LiveData<Throwable> getThrowable() {
106    return throwable;
107  }
108
109  @Override
110  public void onStop(@NonNull LifecycleOwner owner) {
111    pending.clear();
112    DefaultLifecycleObserver.super.onStop(owner);
113
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * This returns a log entry containing the class simple name, the error and the
118   * entire throwable message
119   * @param throwable
120   */
121  private void postThrowable(Throwable throwable){
122    Log.e(TAG, throwable.getMessage(), throwable);
123    this.throwable.postValue(throwable);
124  }
125}
